header: 1 Cri. Bail Appln. No.15/2019 ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 MHPU14-000086-2019

background.text: 1] Present application is filed by the accused namely, Bembatya (accused no.4) with request to grant him bail, u/s.439 of the Code of Criminal Procedure-1973 against whom Crime No. 440 of 2018, is registered in the Baramati City police station (District – Pune ), for having committed offence punishable U/ss. 395, 342, 364A, 384, 506 of I.P.C and 39 of Maharashtra Money Lending Act.

legalActFound.stringMatched: u/s.439 of the code of criminal procedure

arguments.text: 2] It is prosecution case, accused advanced loan to the informant and his brother. It is prosecution case, brother of the informant by name Eknath was in need of amount, so he asked amount to accused no.2 Chaitrali, she advanced loan Rs.10,000/- as against it recovered Rs.1,50,000/-. Accused Chaitrali and others took Eknath to their house, confined in their house and compelled to work.

argumentSentences.text: 2] It is prosecution case, accused advanced loan to the informant and his brother.

It is prosecution case, brother of the informant by name Eknath was in need of amount, so he asked amount to accused no.2 Chaitrali, she advanced loan Rs.10,000/- as against it recovered Rs.1,50,000/-.
Accused Chaitrali and others took Eknath to their house, confined in their house and compelled to work.

arguments.text: 3] It is prosecution case, thereafter informant was in need of Rs.2500/-. He asked amount to accused Nashib, Karan and Chaitrali, they advanced amount on interest, also obtained his signature on stamp paper. They recovered from him Rs.7,000/-. In the month of August accused Akbarya, Vijya, Nasib, Karan, Chaitali visited his house, claimed more amount and beat him. Accused Karan snatched away golden ornament worn by Vinayak son of the informant, accused also threatened him and his family members of taking their lives.

argumentSentences.text: 3] It is prosecution case, thereafter informant was in need of Rs.2500/-.
He asked amount to accused Nashib, Karan and Chaitrali, they advanced amount on interest, also obtained his signature on stamp paper.
They recovered from him Rs.7,000/-.
In the month of August accused Akbarya, Vijya, Nasib, Karan, Chaitali visited his house, claimed more amount and beat him.
Accused Karan snatched away golden ornament worn by Vinayak son of the informant, accused also threatened him and his family members of taking their lives.

arguments.text: 4] It is prosecution case, applicant-accused was with the other accused and helped them in the commission of crime. 5] It is case of prosecution that on getting information of the offence, case is registered against the present accused and others. 6] Learned advocate Mr. A.B. Gaikwad appearing for the accused submitted arguments in the line of application filed.

argumentSentences.text: 4] It is prosecution case, applicant-accused was with the other accused and helped them in the commission of crime.
5] It is case of prosecution that on getting information of the offence, case is registered against the present accused and others.
6] Learned advocate Mr. A.B. Gaikwad appearing for the accused submitted arguments in the line of application filed.

arguments.text: 7] Per contra, learned APP Mr. Wadekar submitted arguments in the line of say submitted by the prosecution. In addition to it, he submitted nature of the offence is serious and other three accused are absconded.

argumentSentences.text: 7] Per contra, learned APP Mr. Wadekar submitted arguments in the line of say submitted by the prosecution.
In addition to it, he submitted nature of the offence is serious and other three accused are absconded.

arguments.text: 8] I have given anxious thought to the arguments advanced on behalf of both the sides. I have perused copy of charge-sheet submitted on behalf of the accused. (On perusal -copy of charge-sheet returned).

argumentSentences.text: 8] I have given anxious thought to the arguments advanced on behalf of both the sides.
I have perused copy of charge-sheet submitted on behalf of the accused.
(On perusal -copy of charge-sheet returned).

arguments.text: 9] Nature of the offence alleged to have committed by the accused is serious. Evidence collected by the prosecution indicates involvement of the accused in the commission of crime.

argumentSentences.text: 9] Nature of the offence alleged to have committed by the accused is serious.
Evidence collected by the prosecution indicates involvement of the accused in the commission of crime.

arguments.text: 10] Same time it cannot be overlooked objection taken on behalf of the prosecution is mainly accused would put pressure upon the witnesses. Investigation is completed. Other accused barring a few are released on bail. No fruitful purpose would be served keeping accused behind bar for indefinite period.

argumentSentences.text: 10] Same time it cannot be overlooked objection taken on behalf of the prosecution is mainly accused would put pressure upon the witnesses.
Investigation is completed.
Other accused barring a few are released on bail.
No fruitful purpose would be served keeping accused behind bar for indefinite period.

arguments.text: 11] Thus, in my opinion, it would to accept request made putting stringent conditions upon the accused. 12] In the result, following order is passed :-

argumentSentences.text: 11] Thus, in my opinion, it would to accept request made putting stringent conditions upon the accused.
12] In the result, following order is passed :-

order.text: ORDER i] Bail application is allowed. ii] Accused Bembtya Ajinath @ Ajya Bhosale (accused no.4) be released on bail on execution of P.B. of Rs.30,000/- with solvent surety in the like amount. iii] Accused not to misuse the liberty given. iv] Accused to submit legally acceptable identity and address proof. v] Applicant accused to visit police station once in a month till completion of trial. vi] Bail before concerned J. M. F. C. till committal of the case and thereafter before the Court to whom case is assigned. Accordingly, order is passed and Bail Application stands disposed of.

processedText:
1 Cri. Bail Appln. No.15/2019 ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 MHPU14-000086-2019 
---header-ends---
1] Present application is filed by the accused namely, Bembatya (accused no.4) with request to grant him bail, u/s.439 of the Code of Criminal Procedure-1973 against whom Crime No. 440 of 2018, is registered in the Baramati City police station (District – Pune ), for having committed offence punishable U/ss. 395, 342, 364A, 384, 506 of I.P.C and 39 of Maharashtra Money Lending Act. 
---background-ends---
2] It is prosecution case, accused advanced loan to the informant and his brother. It is prosecution case, brother of the informant by name Eknath was in need of amount, so he asked amount to accused no.2 Chaitrali, she advanced loan Rs.10,000/- as against it recovered Rs.1,50,000/-. Accused Chaitrali and others took Eknath to their house, confined in their house and compelled to work. 
---argument-ends---
3] It is prosecution case, thereafter informant was in need of Rs.2500/-. He asked amount to accused Nashib, Karan and Chaitrali, they advanced amount on interest, also obtained his signature on stamp paper. They recovered from him Rs.7,000/-. In the month of August accused Akbarya, Vijya, Nasib, Karan, Chaitali visited his house, claimed more amount and beat him. Accused Karan snatched away golden ornament worn by Vinayak son of the informant, accused also threatened him and his family members of taking their lives. 
---argument-ends---
4] It is prosecution case, applicant-accused was with the other accused and helped them in the commission of crime. 5] It is case of prosecution that on getting information of the offence, case is registered against the present accused and others. 6] Learned advocate Mr. A.B. Gaikwad appearing for the accused submitted arguments in the line of application filed. 
---argument-ends---
7] Per contra, learned APP Mr. Wadekar submitted arguments in the line of say submitted by the prosecution. In addition to it, he submitted nature of the offence is serious and other three accused are absconded. 
---argument-ends---
8] I have given anxious thought to the arguments advanced on behalf of both the sides. I have perused copy of charge-sheet submitted on behalf of the accused. (On perusal -copy of charge-sheet returned). 
---argument-ends---
9] Nature of the offence alleged to have committed by the accused is serious. Evidence collected by the prosecution indicates involvement of the accused in the commission of crime. 
---argument-ends---
10] Same time it cannot be overlooked objection taken on behalf of the prosecution is mainly accused would put pressure upon the witnesses. Investigation is completed. Other accused barring a few are released on bail. No fruitful purpose would be served keeping accused behind bar for indefinite period. 
---argument-ends---
11] Thus, in my opinion, it would to accept request made putting stringent conditions upon the accused. 12] In the result, following order is passed :- 
---argument-ends---
ORDER i] Bail application is allowed. ii] Accused Bembtya Ajinath @ Ajya Bhosale (accused no.4) be released on bail on execution of P.B. of Rs.30,000/- with solvent surety in the like amount. iii] Accused not to misuse the liberty given. iv] Accused to submit legally acceptable identity and address proof. v] Applicant accused to visit police station once in a month till completion of trial. vi] Bail before concerned J. M. F. C. till committal of the case and thereafter before the Court to whom case is assigned. Accordingly, order is passed and Bail Application stands disposed of. 
---order-ends---
Baramati ( R.B. Deshpande) 17.01.2019. Addl. Sessions Judge, Baramati. CERTIFICATE “ I affirm that the contents of this PDF file Judgment are same word for word as per original Judgment.
